title: Zoran Manojlović
text:
Zoran Manojlović (born 21 July 1962) is a Serbian <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach who was most recently the coach of Saudi Arabian club <a href="Al-Tai%20FC">Al-Tai</a>.
Career.
Manojlović began his coaching career in Portugal.
Manojlović coached three club sides in Angola, including <a href="C.D.%20Primeiro%20de%20Agosto">Primeiro de Agosto</a> (between December 2017 and July 2019) whom he guided to the <a href="African%20Champions%20League">African Champions League</a> semi-final in 2018. He also served as an assistant coach at <a href="Kabuscorp%20S.C.P.">Kabuscorp</a> in 2012.
Manojlović was appointed head coach of Moroccan club <a href="Wydad%20AC">Wydad AC</a> in July 2019. In November 2019 he said he was "thrilled" to be working at the club. He left the club in January 2020.
In October 2020 he became manager of Sudanese club <a href="Al-Hilal%20Club%20%28Omdurman%29">Al-Hilal Club</a>.
In April 2021 he became manager of Algerian club <a href="CR%20Belouizdad">CR Belouizdad</a>.
On 30 August 2021, Manojlović was appointed as the manager of Saudi Arabian club <a href="Al-Tai%20FC">Al-Tai</a>. On 4 November 2021, he was sacked with the club sitting at the bottom of the table.
